question_stem: Given the function \(f(x) = 5x^{\frac{7}{2}} - 4x^{-3}\), rewrite \(f(x)\) in the form \(ax^m + bx^n\), where \(a\), \(b\), \(m\), and \(n\) are constants.

parts.question_text: Write down the values of \(m\) and \(n\).
parts.solution_text: Comparing \(f(x) = 5x^{\frac{7}{2}} - 4x^{-3}\) to the form \(ax^m + bx^n\), we can see that \(m = \frac{7}{2}\) and \(n = -3\).
